item.title: Andy add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "I took a speed-reading course and read <i>War and Peace</i> in twenty minutes. It involves Russia." -- Woody Allen

item.title: Andy add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Andy add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Andy add a quote by Jean-Paul Sartre
item.description: "If you're lonely when you're alone, you're in bad company." -- Jean-Paul Sartre

item.title: Andy add a quote by Brian Wilson
item.description: "Beware the lollipop of mediocrity; lick it once and you'll suck forever." -- Brian Wilson

item.title: Andy add a quote by John Waters
item.description: "If you go home with somebody, and they don't have books, don't fuck 'em!" -- John Waters

item.title: Andy add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "God created war so that Americans would learn geography." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Andy add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "If you want to know what God thinks of money, just look at the people he gave it to." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Andy add a quote by Kenneth Rexroth
item.description: "I've had it with these cheap sons of bitches who claim they love poetry but never buy a book." -- Kenneth Rexroth

item.title: Andy add a quote by Aldous Huxley
item.description: "You shall know the truth and the truth shall make you mad." -- Aldous Huxley

item.title: Andy add a quote by Charles Willeford
item.description: "Just tell the truth, and they'll accuse you of writing black humor. " -- Charles Willeford

item.title: Andy add a quote by Aldous Huxley
item.description: "Experience is not what happens to a man; it is what a man does with what happens to him." -- Aldous Huxley

item.title: Andy add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "If you want to get laid, go to college. If you want an education, go to the library." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Andy add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "There are no good girls gone wrong - just bad girls found out." -- Mae West

item.title: Andy add a quote by Freidrich Neitzsche
item.description: "The true man wants two things: danger and play. For that reason he wants woman, as the most dangerous plaything." -- Freidrich Neitzsche

item.title: Andy add a quote by Patricia Highsmith
item.description: "Honesty, for me, is usually the worst policy imaginable." -- Patricia Highsmith

item.title: Andy add a quote by Orson Welles
item.description: "If you want a happy ending, that depends, of course, on where you stop your story." -- Orson Welles

item.title: Andy add a quote by Orson Welles
item.description: "I passionately hate the idea of being with it, I think an artist has always to be out of step with his time." -- Orson Welles

item.title: Andy add a quote by Karl Lagerfeld
item.description: "People who say that yesterday was better than today are ultimately devaluing their own existence." -- Karl Lagerfeld

item.title: Andy add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "The trouble with having an open mind, of course, is that people will insist on coming along and trying to put things in it." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Andy add a quote by Bob Dylan
item.description: "To live outside the law you must be honest." -- Bob Dylan

item.title: Andy add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "If you don't have time to read, you don't have the time (or the tools) to write. Simple as that." -- Stephen King

item.title: Andy add a quote by S.E. Hinton
item.description: "California is like a beautiful wild kid on heroin, high as a kite and thinking she's on top of the world, not knowing she's dying, not believing it even if you show her the marks." -- S.E. Hinton

item.title: Andy add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Most people are other people. Their thoughts are someone else's opinions, their lives a mimicry, their passions a quotation." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Andy add a quote by Sophia Loren
item.description: "Sex appeal is fifty percent what you've got and fifty percent what people think you've got." -- Sophia Loren

item.title: Andy add a quote by Gore Vidal
item.description: "Andy Warhol is the only genius I've ever known with an IQ of 60." -- Gore Vidal

item.title: Andy add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "You don't have to burn books to destroy a culture. Just get people to stop reading them." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Andy add a quote by Baruch Spinoza
item.description: "If you want the present to be different from the past, study the past." -- Baruch Spinoza

item.title: Andy add a quote by Keith Moon
item.description: "I mean, you want the truth as you wanna hear it? I can't do that. You couldn't afford me." -- Keith Moon

item.title: Andy add a quote by Brian Eno
item.description: "Whatever you now find weird, ugly, uncomfortable and nasty about a new medium will surely become its signature. CD distortion, the jitteriness of digital video, the crap sound of 8-bit - all of these will be cherished and emulated as soon as they can be avoided. Itâ€™s the sound of failure: so much modern art is the sound of things going out of control, of a medium pushing to its limits and breaking apart. The distorted guitar sound is the sound of something too loud for the medium supposed to carry it. The blues singer with the cracked voice is the sound of an emotional cry too powerful for the throat that releases it. The excitement of grainy film, of bleached-out black and white, is the excitement of witnessing events too momentous for the medium assigned to record them." -- Brian Eno
